DataElement.preferredName: Person New York Heart Association Class II Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has a New York Heart Association Class II or greater disease, a finding associated with a patient with defined or presumed cardiac disease with slight limitation of physical activity, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person New York Heart Association Class II Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having a New York Heart Association Class II or greater disease, a finding associated with a patient with defined or presumed cardiac disease with slight limitation of physical activity, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: New York Heart Association Class II Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A finding associated with a patient with defined or presumed cardiac disease with slight limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea. (from The Criteria Committee of the New York Heart Association. Nomenclature and Criteria for Diagnosis of Diseases of the Heart and Great Vessels. 9th ed. Boston, Mass: Little, Brown & Co; 1994:253-256.):Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.longName: New York Heart Association Class II
Concepts.definition: A finding associated with a patient with defined or presumed cardiac disease with slight limitation of physical activity. They are comfortable at rest. Ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea. (from The Criteria Committee of the New York Heart Association. Nomenclature and Criteria for Diagnosis of Diseases of the Heart and Great Vessels. 9th ed. Boston, Mass: Little, Brown & Co; 1994:253-256.)
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using the New York Heart Asso
ReferenceDocuments.description: Using the New York Heart Association (NYHA) guideline, does the patient have Class II or greater congestive heart failure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: New York Heart Association (NYHA) classification II, III or IV congestive heart failure

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Class II or greater congestive heart failure as described in the New York Heart Association Functional Classification criteria.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: New York Heart Association (NYHA) >= Class II Congestive Heart Failure

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of  NYHA Class III or IV congestive heart failure

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Using the New York Heart Association guideline provided in Appendix III, does the patient have Class II or greater congestive heart failure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Class II or greater congestive heart failure as described in the New York Heart Association Functional Classification criteria or serious arrhythmias likely to increase the risk of cardiac complications of cytokine therapy (e.g. ventricular tachycardia, frequent ventricular ectopy, or supraventricular tachyarrhythmias requiring chronic therapy).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF_Text_6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have congestive heart failure > New York Heart Association (NYHA) class II?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a New York Heart Association functional classification II, III, or IV

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class II or greater congestive heart failure?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1802 Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have New York Heart Association (NYHA) Class II or greater congestive heart failure requiring treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a New York Heart Association functional classification of II, III or IV?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient class 2B or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a New York Heart Association (NYHA) classification of 2B or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a New York Heart Association (NYHA) classification of I or II?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a clinical risk assessment of cardiac function using the New York Heart Association Functional Classification, with a classification of 2B or better?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a New York Heart Association Functional Classification II or better?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Eligibility Ind-2 2018257v1 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
